page.title: 01SOUTH-EAST MAIDSTONE
page.content: This sector of{MAIDSTONE}extends from the town's major street intersection at the{QUEEN'S MONUMENT}(761558) to the separate village of{OTHAM}in sq. 7953. Housing varies from Victorian terraces and newer tower blocks in sq. 7655 to the post-war{SHEPWAY}council estate and private housing still being built at{GROVE GREEN, DOWNSWOOD}and {THE SPIRES.}These private developments including post-war estates in the {ROSEACRE}and{MADGINFORD}areas of {BEARSTED,}are separated from the core of Maidstone by{MOTE PARK,}a protected public amenity of 2.5 sq.km. To the North and South of this park run two major, often congested, road arteries,the{A20}Ashford Road and{A229 Hastings Road. The latter also carries traffic for the{A274}Tenterden Road as far as the{WHEATSHEAF INN,}on the site of original toll-gates at 767539.
